meanings.definition: A small hot-tasting pod of a variety of capsicum, used in cooking.
meanings.sent1: I added some chilies to the soup to make it spicy.
meanings.sent2: The recipe calls for fresh chilies to give it a kick.
meanings.sent3: The chilies in the curry were so fiery, they made my nose run.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a burst of chilies, spreading warmth and joy.
meanings.sent5: The chilies in the salsa were like little bursts of flavor in my mouth.

meanings.definition: A hot-tasting powder made from dried and ground chilies.
meanings.sent1: Sprinkling some chilies on top of the dish added a spicy touch.
meanings.sent2: I prefer using chilies powder in my chili con carne for that extra heat.
meanings.sent3: The cloud of chilies powder that puffed up made everyone sneeze.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a sprinkle of chilies, adding intensity to the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of chilies powder filled the kitchen, making my mouth water.
